document.description: Bottom line: This is a FAST FOOD restaurant. If greasy, unhealthy food ain't your cup o' tea, then don't eat ... They had staff out there helping cars to park and back out ...
document.body:

In-N-Out Burger 39 reviews Rating Details Category: Restaurants Burgers Burgers [Edit] 2131 County Ctr Dr Santa Rosa , CA 95403 (800) 786-1000 http://www.in-n-out.com

" Double double animal style your my only friend." In 2 reviews "Best damn fast food joint ever." In 8 reviews "...a lot closer instead of having to drive to Rohnert Park ." In 3 reviews Loading... Sort by: Yelp Sort | Date | Rating | Elites' | Facebook Friends' Facebook Friends
From Reviewers You're Following
Reviews from Your Friends
39 reviews in English
Review from Roland F.
27 friends 73 reviews
Roland F.
Petaluma, CA 6/4/2012 1 Check-in Here A much needed addition to Santa Rosa. Since A&W departed (the REAL A&W, not the KFC/A&W crap), Santa Rosa hasn't had a decent fast food burger.
This In-N-Out gets considerably more busy than your average fast food (or even In-N-Out), especially around lunch. The parking lot arrangement doesn't help. Orders can take forever, and although it's not the hardworking employees' fault, it can throw a serious kink in what you hoped would a quick, greasy lunch. Beyond that, it's In-N-Out. It's cheap, delicious, and Animal-ly.
Was this review…?
Useful Funny (1) Cool
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from John w.
0 friends 12 reviews
John w.
Santa Rosa, CA 6/3/2012 After years of driving to RP to get In n Out I was happy one came to town.
I think the RP one is better (they give you more veggies in your burger and when you as for extra everything it's exploding with veggies - in SR it's hard to tell the difference) but it's still a deliciuos in n out experience.
I think they are better (and better value) than 5 guys and love the toasted bun.
The only downside is that, as expected, having one so close to home has taken some of the specialness out of having an in n out...
On the plus side it's on the way home from the gym so I can indulge in a protein style burger, have a delicious snack and feel only mildly guilty about it!
Was this review…?
Useful Funny Cool
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Matthew W.
8 friends 38 reviews
Matthew W.
Clearlake, CA 3/31/2012 After hearing so much about I-and-Out burger AND getting one in Reno finally (back when I lived there), this was the first of this franchise I have ever tried out, and I have to say it was disappointing compare dot the hype.
While still the best of the fast-food burgers, it still seems sub-par to most any local bar-and-grill location.
Now, don't take it to mean I dislike this food, I was just hearing so much about how good it was, that it was a large disappointment to finally eat here and taste what seemed like the best of the low-quality burgers (McDonald's, Burger King, etc).
The establishment was fine enough with clean surfaces and courteous staff. I think the largest thing that would keep me from coming back in the future is how busy it usually is.
Was this review…?
Useful Funny Cool
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Michelle C.
Elite '12 1377 friends 870 reviews
Michelle C.
Philadelphia, PA 3/25/2012 1 Check-in Here In-N-Out is a west coast staple for me, and this was one of my better experiences. Animal-style with cheese and an order of cheese fries were devoured rather quickly.
Head inside to avoid the drive-thru line.
Listed in: The Chain Gang , The Burger List , California Wine Country

San Francisco, CA 1/14/2012 5 Check-ins Here The burgers are good.
But the parking situation sucks here! I always get blocked in by people waiting in the drive through, and that's WHEN I find a spot.
Listed in: In Pursuit of a Better Burger

Review from Nick B.
Elite '12 14 friends 163 reviews
Nick B.
Boca Raton, FL 1/9/2012 This is your standard In-N-Out.
I went here on a Saturday night and the line of cars in the drive through wrapped around the building; that didn't matter because I ate inside. My order was ready in under ten minutes, and it tasted just like the delicious In-N-Out I've loved as a CA native!
In-N-Out, that's what hamburgers are all about! (Just not the fries - avoid those, you can get better ones elsewhere. :P).
Was this review…?
Useful (1) Funny Cool
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Lorenzo L.
0 friends 5 reviews
Lorenzo L.
Santa Rosa, CA 5/26/2012 I'm a total fan of vanilla milk shakes and french fries. Dipping those fries into that vanilla milk shake makes my day better and I find myself being nicer to other people when I treat myself to this indulgence.
Was this review…?
Useful Funny Cool
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Jeremy H.
2 friends 58 reviews
Jeremy H.
Santa Rosa, CA 11/10/2011 This review is for the Santa Rosa one since that's the one I got dragged to recently. But I've been to the one at Fisherman's Wharf, the one in Rohnert Park, one down in the Peninsula somewhere and one somewhere in Nevada. Exact same experience at all of them.
Look, I understand about regionalism, and nostalgia for chains where you grew up. I'm from western PA and I salivate a little thinking about Eat N' Park, but if I took you there, you'd wonder why I was going off about some marginally-better-than-Denny's diner chain.
Native Californians, please try and understand that you *may* be overrating In-N-Out just a *bit* due to childhood nostalgia/brainwashing. The burgers are decent, but they aren't the amazing experience everyone always carps on about them being. The fries are downright below-average, limp and doused in too much salt. The prices are pretty good, and the burgers are good enough that that alone might make the place worth the trip ... if it wasn't for the constant 2-mile lines in both the restaurant and the drive-thru at every location, every minute that they are open. The food does not even come close to meriting the wait. Anyone who insists that this is a "quality" burger better than something at a sit-down restaurant with steak fries, or even a place like Pearl's or Five Guys, is legitimately out of their mind.
The vibe if you eat in is also weird. This place makes people act shifty and bizarre. Everyone gives you a Clint Eastwood look when you come in, like you just strolled into the wrong saloon. People eyeball you constantly like you're gonna try to steal their place in line or swipe their Animal Style right off the table in front of them. Watch where you put your hands when you go to get more napkins or some concealed-carryin' granny might quickdraw on you.
Was this review…?
Useful Funny (1) Cool
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Kevin J.
Elite '12 1796 friends 683 reviews
Kevin J.
San Francisco, CA 5/31/2011 2 Check-ins Here I'd like to know who doesn't like In-N-Out? Vegetarian/Vegans don't coutn. I'm talking to the meat people. Whether you're a health nut (don't get fries and opt for a bun-less burger with "Protein Style") or a Quarter pounder freak(grab a "Double Double", Triple Triple, or whatever number your heart desires) In-N-Out burger will do you right.
Animal style adds mustard, diced grilled onions, and pickles onto your burger or fries(sans pickles/mustard) while grilled cheese sandwiches, protein style burgers and I'm sure others don't quite make the menu. Some secrets have to remain, but who says you can't have it "your way" at this burger joint?
5 Guys who?
Listed in: Burgers-A-Hoolanhan
Was this review…?
Useful (3) Funny (1) Cool (2)
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Corey G.
Elite '12 109 friends 1460 reviews
Corey G.
Richland, WA 5/1/2011 1 Check-in Here Can I buy stock in In N Out? Man, they always have lines warranting traffic control. City Planners must have a hissy-fit when In N Out announces intentions of opening a space in town.
Do I care? Heck no.
I just want me a burger, fries, and a pink lemonade. I don't care if I need a sleep air traffic controller to guide my pony to the drive-thru window.
There's not much to say about the food. It's the same deliciousness as with any In N Out experience. This is one of the northernmost stands on the 101 though. So if you're heading northward, it's your duty to stop on by!
Was this review…?
Useful (4) Funny (2) Cool (7)
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from kainoa r.
33 friends 173 reviews
kainoa r.
Santa Rosa, CA 2/4/2011 ROTD 3/8/2011 Big fan of the In-N-Out. Love the burgers, the shakes, the sauce, grilled onions, chili peppers, all of it.
Almost all of it.
I can't get into the fries unless they're animal style. Not sure if it's the Kennebunk potatoes they use, or the fact they aren't double-fried, or that they use vegetable oil... but something ain't right. Smack them up and down with sauce and cheese and all is fine. Without? The horror.
Everything else at this location is your standard In-N-Out fare, with one exception. For some reason, they go light on the sauce. And the sauce? I like it. I want it. I NEED it. Not on every burger everywhere, but if I'm there... I gots to have me some. So don't go skimping my sauce.
Was this review…?
Useful (2) Funny (3) Cool (2)
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from Hasan T.
1 friend 59 reviews
Hasan T.
Rohnert Park, CA 4/28/2011 Honestly, I don't really see the purpose of reviewing In-N-Out. If you're from California, and you don't currently live under a rock, then you pretty much should know what you're getting. Ah screw it...
I'll say this about In-N-Out. It is without a doubt, the best fast food restaurant around. The food is fresh (which by itself puts it above most of its brethren), and the service is always top notch. The location of this particular In-N-Out is terrible, though. I don't know what they were thinking...
Bottom line: This is a FAST FOOD restaurant. If greasy, unhealthy food ain't your cup o' tea, then don't eat here. If you've got a hankering for a quick, filling burger and some fries then give 'em a shot.
P.S: The best time to go is at night, when the line isn't halfway to Windsor. When it's midnight and you've just got done enjoying you're favorite, ahem "herbal remedy", there's nothing like a double-double to vanquish your munchies.
Was this review…?
Useful (1) Funny Cool (2)

Review from alice k.
7 friends 14 reviews
alice k.
Santa Rosa, CA 12/14/2010 This location forgot one of my burgers that I paid for through the Drive-Thru a couple of weeks ago.
It hurt my feelings. And I had to pretend I wasn't hungry and let someone else eat mine. I live 20 mins away from Santa Rosa, but in-n-out is seriously the only drive-thru place closest to me that is open past midnight. And I did not feel like driving back and waiting in the HUGE line to see if they would give it to me or not. I've learned to check my bags, though I do grudgingly point out this has never happened in Rohnert Park.
Well.. I've forgiven you. Just don't let it happen again please. Because I do love your animal-style fries like crazy.

Believe it or not, there's not that many on the way back to NorCal. It was this or eating in downtown Santa Rosa again and I can't believe I chose fast food! Sure hit the spot...

San Francisco, CA 12/12/2011 2 Check-ins Here I'm happy to say that the SR In-n-Out crew has really gotten their act together over the last several months. Once green, they have taken the initiative and brought one of the chain's newest locations up to brand standard. Fantastic work indeed.

Review from Sheri M.
11 friends 84 reviews
Sheri M.
East Boston, MA 11/5/2010 My favorite fast food joint, now only 5 minutes away! We were in Europe during the grand opening and went for some grub the day we returned... after flying over 12 hours, and getting stuck in the damn Giants parade trying to catch the bus home. Needless to say, we were ravenous. The food was amazing as usual (I had a 3x3 for the first time). I would have been forgiving if they had messed up somehow, but they didn't! But there was one thing that irked me...
I'm not sure what the designers were smoking when they planned it, but the drive-thru set-up sucks. The queue runs right through the parking lot. What the hell?! They had staff out there helping cars to park and back out, but I doubt they'll have them out there permanently. This is the first In-N-Out I've been to that doesn't have a dedicated area for cars to queue up. I smell a potential disaster.
Listed in: SoCo under $10

Review from Nikki W.
38 friends 234 reviews
Nikki W.
Santa Rosa, CA 6/20/2011 We are at 3 stars here because we all know the food is Delicious and you can count on it to be the same everywhere, what you can't count on is parking/time to order. This place has the most ridiculous parking and "waiting in line for the drive up" that I've ever seen. Sooo poorly designed! You are waiting with your car hanging out in the street, the drive through spits you out where the other cars are trying to come in, it is a total mess- it really deters me. I'd rather drive to petaluma then this location. Sorry In and Out but you should have hired a better engineer to make this run smoothly, for now it really bites!
Listed in: Burgers

Fresh potatoes in the fries, watch them cut them in front of you! Beef from their own source too, not the giant, nasty, mega slaughter bin the other chains use. They treat their employees well too.

Review from amanda l.
2 friends 10 reviews
amanda l.
Forestville, CA 5/4/2011 if only all fast food was this good!! they dont mess around. fresh lettuce and tomatoes on top of real beef, never frozen. their walls and uniforms are imaculet white, fit for surgery if you ask me. you can see them prepare your food fresh through the big stretch windows. they got nothing to hide. service was excellent. you can tell these people are proud to be a part of such a wonderful place. for their best burger ask for it animal style (its not on the menu). aside from here i dont touch fast food.

Review from Pixie D.
4 friends 17 reviews
Pixie D.
Santa Rosa, CA 11/22/2010 Why is there so much hype about this chain? It sucked! First, hubby got the burger, although I don't know why he'd take his life in his hands by eating that, but he said he has gotten better burgers at McDonalds and Burger King, and this one made Wendy's burgers seem gourmet. And I don't know why someone yelped that here they don't use "wonder bread style" buns, because they absolutely were just as gummy and disgusting as wonder bread. The cashier was really dumb. First he told me I could get a bun with lettuce&tomato, but they don't have veggie burgers, or I could get "grilled cheese," which is really a cheeseburger with no burger - nothing grilled about it. But when I found out that the kind with just cheese costs MORE than a hamburger (!??!), he said I could get a veggie burger for $1.30. So I said how do I change my order and get my money back for the difference between a veggie burger and a "grilled cheese." Of course he didn't know, but when a "manager" finally came over, he reiterated that there was NO veggie burger, just a nothing sandwich. So of course I kept the cheese, and it sucked. This was after I had to repeat my order half a dozen times because he kept saying he only rang up one cheeseburger. When I could not get through to him (having repeated my order of one cheeseburger and one "grilled cheese" a few times already!), and finally said excuse me, I was sure you said I could order one with just cheese, the other two cashiers burst out laughing. I don't even know if they were dissing me or him, but even a dimwit should have been able to ring up that order properly. And he forgot it was not to go - although who would get out of their car in the rain when they could use the drive-through if they actually wanted it to go? This place does not foster common sense! Btw, why do they say they have good fries? There is such high turnover in this place they should have been freshly made and hot, but they weren't! I do think the fries may have been cut from real potatoes, as I heard they were, because I could see several black, rotten spots that they had not taken the care to pick out. Disgusting, and so disrespectful to the customers!!! P.S. the decor was very generic and cheaper than typical McDonalds.
Was this review…?
Useful (1) Funny (2) Cool (1)
Add owner comment Bookmark Send to a Friend Link to This Review
Review from ROBERT H.
0 friends 8 reviews
ROBERT H.
Santa Rosa, CA 12/23/2010 at this in n' out, the drive through entrance must be approached from the southbound lane of county center drive, as there is a center island. i came from steele lane and took the first entrance to then loop around into the drive through lane. about 3 cars in front of me did the same thing. well they had this guy telling people not to come in this way. so i when he talked to me , i explained to him this is a situational inconvenience. he became agitated and lectured me about next time i come to pull in the other way, wow. so it's bad enough that it's poorly designed and if you have to go out of your way to go there but i never made it in without in n' out employee's confronting me. i turned around and left. i will never return.
